turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: The information we need is embedded in the grain of wood.  And since each piece is unique, the shape and grain is impossible to duplicate.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I'm sure you've all grasped the legalistic drawback to precrime methodology.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Because of the nature of murder.  "There's nothing more destructive to the metaphysical fabric that binds us than the untimely murder of one human being by another".

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Somehow, I don't think that was Walt Whitman.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Don't worry.  I'll bring him in unharmed.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Actually, Gordon, you're not gonna do that.  I'm taking control of the team.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Sir, the team's gonna be light without those men.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Here's where we're at.  Three men in a room.  The victims here. Anderton here, and this unidentified male out the window. The exterior of the adjacent building suggests public housing, but I can't make out the location. Government architecture is modern/conformist which means --

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: There's thousands of units like this one.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: They're everywhere.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Anderton's smart enough to go where electronic billboards and other media can't ID him to pick his pocket.  There's fewer consumers down there, which means fewer scanners to target him.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: No offense, sir, but why wouldn't he just run?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Because he thinks he's innocent.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: There are two others in the room besides Anderton and Crow.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Two?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: It doesn't matter.  He wins.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: We can stop him.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: She's in the room with him when he kills Crow.  She's already a part of his future.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: He's trying to prove his innocence.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: He can't download her without a lot of technical help.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: No.  He can't...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: There a maid in this hotel?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I don't know, why?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: If you were a child killer, you took these pictures, would you leave them out on the bed for anyone to find?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: They could have been put away. Anderton could have found them.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: What kind of cop were you before this?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I was a Treasury Agent for eight years.  Why?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Treasury... Then this would be your first actual murder scene.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I worked homicide before I went federal.  This is what we would've called an "orgy of evidence".  Do you know how many orgies I had as a homicide copy, Gordon?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: None.  This was arranged.

turns.speaker: KNOTT
turns.text: That's why you asked to partner with me on this little sortie, isn't it?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I think you're swell company, Knott.

turns.speaker: KNOTT
turns.text: It's not at all that you don't trust me to be alone with the Chief.  That you think I might, you know, fuck with him, if I had the chance...

turns.speaker: KNOTT
turns.text: People, if you don't let the spyder scan you, we'll have to come in and arrest you.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Knott!

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Why don't I feel like celebrating?

turns.speaker: KNOTT
turns.text: Cause all of a sudden you got no one you can fucking brown nose anymore.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: John Anderton was my friend!

turns.speaker: KNOTT
turns.text: You "friend's" a murderer and he ruined our perfect record.  Six years, not one damn murder...

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: He looks familiar.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: The man across the street.  I've seen him before...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: How can you even tell?  You know how blind you are without your glasses.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What about your meeting?

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: I'll reschedule.  I've been working too much anyway.

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: We could have lunch together.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'd love to, but I've got an open house today at the Ressler place.

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: Ah.  That must be why you look so nice.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Raincheck?

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: Sure.  Raincheck.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Howard --

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: I forgot my glasses.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: My name is Danny Witwer.  I'm --

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I know who you are.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: This your work?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: I like it.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Thanks.  You take anything in your coffee?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Cream and sugar.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I don't have any cream.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Just sugar then.  You and John ever come here?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: We used to, every summer.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: He's not here now, is he?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I don't have any sugar either.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Thank you.  He hasn't tried to contact you?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You ever heard him mention the name Leo Crow?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: No, but then I don't talk to John that much anymore.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: So you haven't seen his apartment?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: That was our apartment.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Have you been there recently?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Since right after we lost our son.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You mean after he lost your son.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: It was nobody's fault.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: But John was with him at the pool?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You said in your divorce papers that he tried to kill himself.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: It wasn't a suicide attempt.  I regret ever saying that.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: What was it then?

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: The FBI found something that belonged to my son.  A sandal... Anyway, John was upset. He... he...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: He took out his gun and sat down to watch his home movies.  This is all in your statement, Lara...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: He shot a hole in the damn ceiling. So what?  You lose your son, let's see how well you handle it.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Not very well, I'm sure.  I'd probably start doping myself.  Or maybe I'd...

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Lamar Burgess thinks that you left John because he lost himself in Precrime instead of you.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I left him because every time I looked at him, I saw my son.  Every time I got close to him, I smelled my little boy.  That's why I left him.  And now you can leave.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: You know I need to use you.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: To what?  Trap him?

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: To prevent a murder.  Sooner or later, he's going to contact you.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I haven't seen him in two years.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: But I've seen the three hundred hours of your image he's got stored away.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Nice to meet you, Wally.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Shhh!  They're sleeping.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Tell me how all this works.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: They've never been separated before.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: What does he want with a precog?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: What do you think?  So he can kill whoever he wants to without anyone knowing about it.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: But there's still the other two.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Wally, the other two can still function, right?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: You don't understand... they're a hive mind.  It takes all three for their predictive abilities to work.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Are you telling me they can't see murders anymore?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Maybe if he'd taken one of the males.  But the female, she's the key.  She's the one they listen to, the one with the most talent.  The one who takes care of the other two.

turns.speaker: WITWER
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Look, Bobby, I don't know what happened, and I don't want to know what happened, but something's up.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Maxie wants me to replace you on the job tomorrow. He wants you to come by the office today.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: They were grabbing her fucking ass --

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Hey. I don't know, I don't want to know. Far as I'm concerned, you're a good kid. I got news, though, without you here I can't keep on your friend. I got enough people pretending to sweep.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Do me a favor, Arthur, keep him on til I see what's happening.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi, uh, excuse me. I'm here to see Mr. Reuben.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You're Bobby, right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Good afternoon, Bobby. I'll let Max know you're here.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He'll be a minute, hon. You want some coffee?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You sure? I just made it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, thank you. I'm good. Thanks.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Martel's and coke. One ice cube. In a snifter this time.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Snifter are for warm drinks --

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Yeah, snifters are for cognac --

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: When served warm --

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: What's the matter? You ain't got no snifters in this motherfucker?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: We have snifters

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Then put my Martel's in a snifter.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: ...And here is the key to the mini- bar. Room and tax has been picked up by Cardiff Giant, as well as one fifty in incidentals.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: What's 'incidentals?'

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Phone, room service, mini-bar. Any additional expense. If you need anything you can push the button marked 'Concierge', and they'll be able to help you.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Now, Mr. Slade, you're in room 315.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Just give me the key. I'm gonna stay here.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Is it a good room?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: I can take you down there.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Just tell me. Wait, here... Do you have change of a hundred?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Not on me, sir.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Here. Take it. Bring me back eighty.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah. Take it.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Thank you very much, sir.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: What, sir?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Is it the good room?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: All the suites are about the same.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Come on. Just tell me. It'll save all the trouble of you showing me all the rooms.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Honestly, the suites are all about the same.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: What if I gave you forty?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: It's as good a suite as we have, unless you want two bedrooms.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: No. That's cool. Bring me back eighty.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Where's the place to go tonight?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: As far as...?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Nightlife. Where's the hot ass?

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: Women?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Yeah 'women.' If I was a fag I could get laid in a subway.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: I don't know, Forum's pretty hot tonight. It might be hard to get in, though.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Don't worry about me getting in. Just tell me where it is.

turns.speaker: BELLMAN
turns.text: It's on West Broadway.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So, wait, you're from where?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Manhattan.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: You girls aren't from Brooklyn or anything?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I don't get it. What do you do?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: We're in Fashion.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: So you're models?

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: I don't know about you guys, but I'm starting to feel a really sexual vibe here.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: What happened? I thought we were playing Truth or Dare.

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Look at, ladies. I could sit here and take turns throwing skittles at your ass all night. But I feel what you guys are putting out there. I'm only a mirror reflecting what I'm getting from you. And I'm saying yes to it. I'm shaking hands with it. I see the road that you're pointing down and I'm saying I'll ride shotgun. And when your foot slams on the accelerator, I won't get scared. I'll stand up and let the wind blow through my long blonde hair. With my summer dress clinging to my bosom yelling 'Faster, Billy! Faster! Drive faster! Faster yet -- !'

turns.speaker: RICKY
turns.text: Okay. We got a lot happening here. Here comes the good part... Okay...

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Somebody's getting comfortable.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Will you leave me alone, already...? No, Sean, it's over... I don't care... As a matter of fact, I am... Yeah. In his hotel room...

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I'm having fun, Sean. Can you handle that...? Yeah. He doesn't judge me.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Is he cute?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: He's okay.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Should I fuck him?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: I don't know. Do whatever you want.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: He's great, right. Is he great?

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: He's alright.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: But maybe that's okay. Maybe that's just what you need.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Oh no. What is it this time.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: We used to take baths together.

turns.speaker: BIANCA
turns.text: Come on. Let's go.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: What the fuck was that about?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You wanna get us busted? If Max found out you were turning tricks --

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I got news for you, Bobby, he don't give a shit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: You think he don't know? I give him his cut of seventeen hundred, I think he knows I can't make that lap dancing.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No more.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nobody's fuckin talking to you.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: And how could you fucking leave Horrace hanging?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I got news for you, Horrace got his ass out of there before you did.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What? You don't think Horrace would leave your white ass in there to hang?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: Ricky's not wearing one.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ricky, can you put on a seat belt?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: A elephant seal. Where's mommy?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She's, uh, sleeping.

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: It's daytime.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mommy works hard so you can have all your pretty clothes. Don't you like your pretty clothes?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Show uncle Ricky what you made.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's wrong, baby?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: He's not doing it.

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: It's a poison arrow tree frog.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Will you paint the damn thing. Why do you gotta be such a baby.

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: You're not my daddy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You gonna bust my horns, or you want spaghetti

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: I want spaghettis.

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Chloe?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: Uncle Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi, baby. What are you doing awake? Where's mommy?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mommy's not home?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What time is it there?

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: Can you take me to Color Me Mine?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. Are you sure mommy's not home? It's very late.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I gotta go, baby. I love you. Tell mommy I called. You be a big girl and be careful when you're alone.

turns.speaker: CHLOE
turns.text: I love you. Come home.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Honey?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So, what kind of gig is this?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Easy night. Bachelor party. Can we give Wendy a ride?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. What kind of bachelor party?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: The easy kind. They're young and rich and well mannered.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Oh my god. What happened?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: A draw. What makes you think they're well mannered?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Bobby, this is a plumb gig. It's a bunch of young agents and it's at a restaurant. It's gonna be easy and we'll make a lot of money.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't like you working with Wendy. Why are you working with Wendy?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: They requested her. It was her gig. Max put me on as a favor.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Some favor. I hope they know you're not like Wendy.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Oh, please.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: If they asked for her, they're probably expecting blowjobs all around.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Will you cut it out! Get ready, we're already late.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Who's watching the baby?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: She's downstairs with Ruth. Get ready.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm ready.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Bullshit. These are classy customers. You can't show up all fucked up with a Fila running suit on.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: They're not too classy to have tits rubbed in their face.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You talk to Max today?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: I'm not gonna mention Ricky to him.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't expect you to mention it to him. I'm just saying, if --

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: The only way he'll go with Ricky is if you're in too.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, that's not gonna happen.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Fine. You want to help Ricky, talk to Maxie yourself.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I feel weird asking him.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: You shouldn't. He likes you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I just wish he never brought it up. Ricky won't shut up about it.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Forget Ricky. You should be glad Max got you driving for me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No coke tonight.  Right?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Leave me alone. I haven't touched anything in months.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Go finish getting ready. I'll take care of dinner.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Yeah? You sure?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No way that cocksucker's driving you.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Maybe if you didn't go Rambo every time I did a lapdance, you'd still be doing it yourself. Meantime, I gotta feed my little girl.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Maxie's fucking with me. He put you with the spook to get under my skin.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Ho's a good guy --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ho's a fucking pimp! He encourages Wendy to turn tricks. And she's his fucking wife!

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Shhh. He'll hear you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Good! It'll save me the trouble of repeating myself. He's not fucking driving you!

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Listen to me, Bobby. This is my job. It puts a roof over me and my daughter and you for as long as you want to stay.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I want you to quit.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Look at the bills. I can't. I'm not gonna put my daughter through what I went through.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll support you.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: With what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Max offered to stake me.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Yeah, well Max offers a lot of things. And I got news for you. He's not the sweet old man you think he is.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She needs a family. A dad. I'll give her what you never had.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Don't get my hopes up. If I quit, what then? I can't go through this again.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: I never promised you anything.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How could you let her see this?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Goodbye, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Just so you know, I bought you out with Maxie. I suggest you leave while you can.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Don't you get it? I don't want to leave. This is who I am.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Tell you the truth, I don't give a shit for me. But that little girl is so special, and you're gonna fuck her up.

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: Take her.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: JESS
turns.text: I want you to take her with you.

turns.speaker: HORNY GUY
turns.text: Whu --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: There's no touching.

turns.speaker: HORNY GUY
turns.text: But what about them?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't give a shit. I work for her. No touching.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I said no touching.

turns.speaker: HORNY GUY
turns.text: Look, man, I'm the bachelor, alright? I gave her a hundred bucks in tips alone --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Get your hands off of her.

turns.speaker: HORNY GUY
turns.text: Dude, listen, man. I'm cool. How much for the treatment?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Your dance is over.

turns.speaker: HORNY GUY
turns.text: Come on, dude. The other chick's giving my best man a blow job in the toilet. I know the drill, I'll wear a rubber --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: It's already been a hell of a night. Where you been?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I had a fight up at Sportsman's.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Well, you look it. You win?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Draw.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: What's your record at?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Yeah, well you let me know when you wanna start makin the real money.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: I'm serious. Humping sheetrock and driving on weekends got to get to you after a while. Might be nice to buy your lady something. All it takes is one fight.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: What's up? Jess ready?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You driving her?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She'll be out in a minute.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: C'mon girl. Eat up.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Get away from her.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Excuse --

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: What's up. You all ready to meet Ruiz?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. Where is he?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He making the drop?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Nah, man. He's just making contact. That's our man. The Welsh guy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Ruiz don't like using names on cell phones. He refers to him as the Red Dragon.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So, when's the drop.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: To be honest, man, I don't know shit either. All I know is it ain't drugs and it ain't now.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How bad is it?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: It's bad. Before you even showed up, he said you were Maxie's 'token goons', and not to be trusted. He wanted to TCB alone. I was gonna ride shotgun to keep the English dude above board. Now he's spooked. This shit's snowballing.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: When's it going down?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Was gonna be tomorrow morning. Now, who knows?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why isn't Ruiz coming?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: This Welsh dude is tripping on Ruiz cause he's a Shot Caller.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: A Shot Caller. A boss, a Capo. He's running shit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So what do we do?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: We go and hang out with the dude, make him happy, drink some tea, whatever it takes, until he feels comfortable enough to bring it up on his own. We make the drop, go home to California.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where is this happening?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: We meet at the Globe on Park Avenue at six forty-five. I'll see you then.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Now, here's what worries me. He said he wants to meet up at a bar in Red Hook. You know where that is?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Brooklyn.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: He must have that shit troughed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you mean 'troughed?'

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Troughed off. Protected. Like, you know, like he got a moat around it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ruiz tied in out there?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Nah, man. No one is. They got some Puerto Ricans and a new crop of fuckin Irish immigrants.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Heard of them.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: They ran shit back in the Eighties. Used to cut motherfuckers heads off and sit them on the bar. That's back when the Irish was making a play against the Italians. I don't know if they still around, but I don't fuck with those motherfuckers just in case.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It sounds to me like everybody's just a little jumpy. And since all it is is a drop, the Welshman's got nothing at stake. I say we go to his 'troughed off' bar. It'll calm his nerves, we drop the bag, and we all get back to our lives.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: And not a word to Maxie. He'll shit if he knew we crossed a bridge.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where we going?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Quick drop. In and out.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where's Ricky?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: Ricky's taken care of.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: He was uptown when I paged him. I gave him the address. He's meeting us there.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That it?

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: This is it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where's Ricky.

turns.speaker: HORRACE
turns.text: I guess inside. Or he never made it. Either way, I don't give a shit. Let's get this over with.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You like the ponies?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure. Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You bet the ponies?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Me? No. Not really.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Smart. Hard as hell to handicap. You know what I like? Hai Alai. Fast game. You know why I like it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's fixed. That's the only way to win. A sure thing. See that horse. The blaze.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This one?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah. The blaze. I bought her in '66. Hired a trainer, stall, whatever it was. That horse made me over a hundred grand. In 'sixties' dollars. You know what that is today?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Pshhh...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A million. Easy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: She was fast, huh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Never won a race. But it got me in with the trainer. We'd have a thing, I don't remember, some fucking thing. The jockey would raise his whip, it meant the fix was in, we'd all go running. People get greedy. First they bet small, they keep their mouth shut. Within a month's time, everyone and their brother was in on it. The odds would drop, I mean you could watch the goddamn board. It looked like a fuckin stopwatch, the odds would drop so fast.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That's why they call it the smart money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I like you, kid. Why do you gotta make it so hard for me to take care of you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mr. Reuben, I swear to God, they were out of line.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Last time, maybe, with the Puerto Ricans, but these were nice Jewish boys.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: They were out of line --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They're fucking yeshiva buchas. You didn't have to tear up the goddamn place. You knocked out a guys teeth.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: That prick tried to get Jessica to blow him in the bathroom --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bobby, I love Jessica like she's my own daughter. I would kill anyone so much as lays a finger on her or her beautiful daughter, but that fucking pisher you socked in the mouth has the most expensive dentist in Beverly Hills and wants I should buy him an implant. Your silverback horseshit's gonna cost me eight grand.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll work it off.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not driving Jess, you won't.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're not driving Jess no more. Two strikes, Bobby, and this last one was big. The bachelor's father goes to my schul.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So, that's it. I'm out?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I didn't say that.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Then what are you saying?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bobby. You're a bull terrier and I got you herding sheep.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's my fault. I send you out to watch scum drool all over the love of your life, then I wonder why you seered. It's my fault. The tooth is on me. But no more. I'm 'reassigning' you.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't want to drive another girl, Max. The only reason I'm --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who the fuck do you think you're talking to? This ain't a fucking democracy. You want out?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't I put food on you're table? I sponsor your training, I take care of your girl and her little baby. I even pay that deadbeat friend of yours to push a goddamn broom.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Now you wanna shut up and listen and hear what I got to say?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. Sorry.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I got a way we make everybody happy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We try something out. There's someone I'm in business with named Ruiz. I want you to accompany him on a drop.  Just as scenery. Ruiz has his boys. I just want a big guinea with a busted up face to give him a deep bench. As a deterrent.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ruiz knows about this?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ruiz wants to go alone, but it's not up to Ruiz. It's up to me, and I like a sure thing. Just go and we're square on the tooth.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What about Ricky? He'd jump at the opportunity.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ricky? Ricky 'I lost the truck' Ricky?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You told him you liked him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That was before he lost my carpet cleaning van.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He'll work it off.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know the kid, and what little I do scares me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He's good people, Mr. Reuben. I swear.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You vouch for him?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah. Sure.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How 'bout this. If you're in, he's in.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I gotta tell you, Mr. Reuben, I'm not comfortable getting in any deeper. It's one thing to look after Jess...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're ready to move up. Christ, the way you busted up the place, you're doing worse already. May as well get paid instead of punished.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: It's not that I don't appreciate the offer...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Do me a favor. Think about it. Is that too much too ask?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. Okay. I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes, for expenses and such. Now, you'll be contacted on your pager as to where you should go. You each have been given an extra battery, so there is absolutely no excuse as to why a page would not be immediately returned. Am I making myself abundantly clear?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want --

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not you. I want Ricky to answer.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I already told you, I parked it for five minutes and I locked it with the club --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You want us to be wherever you want us to be, ASAP, no questions asked.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: There won't be a next thing.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Take a few days --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't need a few days. I'm gonna settle down with Jess. She's through dancing. We're opening a restaurant.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I hate to ruin your fairy tale, but I've been paying Jess' rent for six months. She's got to keep dancing --

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: That's him. Now you all know the drill, right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What drill?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: 'Dis?' 'Dis?' You're not in a position to 'dis', or 'give props', or whatever your Real World sense of fucking decorum tells you to do. You're nothing. You're wallpaper. You're not here to make fucking friends. Asking a motherfucker where he lives. And who the fuck told you 'Red Dragon'?.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We get it. We're sorry.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Now that Limey motherfucker's jumpy and wants to change shit around on me. Maxie's gonna shit a Nokia when he hears about... Aw, shit, I better call him before he hears.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Jesus Christ, where the fuck you been all night? You look like you got shit out in the gorilla house.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Don't 'easy Ruiz' me. Y'all turned a Easter egg hunt into a butt-fuck-a- thon.  Bring me four eggs Benedict and a mimosa. You all want mimosas?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nah, man...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: A bad heart.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: I didn't tell him shit. He worries too much. I love that old Jew, but he's gonna kill himself worrying. We started this shit, and we're gonna finish it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Tom, the Welsh dude --

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Now listen. The gig couldn't be simpler. You carry the money to the Welshman, he checks it, hands you his marker, you're done. The washed money goes directly to Maxie. Long as you hand off the bag, you're tight.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where's the drop?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: You three are gonna meet him for dinner. Find out if and where. Now any of you motherfuckers got anything else to say?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hi. I, uh, think that's us.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hi. I'm Jimmy.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You're going to the Soho Grand hotel, right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not sure. All I know is the account is Cardiff Giant.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah. You're staying at the Soho Grand. You got anything checked?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Traveling light. I like that.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where is the Soho Grand?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Soho.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: So, Jimmy, you know where this address is?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah. I'll find it. It's in Harlem.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Harlem? What is it, a restaurant?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You don't know where you're going?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. Just the cross streets.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Well, this is the corner.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I can wait around if you want.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. That's cool, man.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Spa?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Depends what night.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: 'Trustafarians?'

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You know, white kids with trust funds acting like they're poor. Keeping it real. Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: This Ruiz guy, what's his deal?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't know much. I hear he runs a tight ship.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Understand me?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Aren't we waiting for Ricky?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Ricky's taken care of.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Taken care of?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah, he's getting there on his own.
